reviews.review_text: I received this product free from Sephora as part of a gratis box. It was my first time ever trying a Pat McGrath product, and I have to say, it lived up to the hype! It goes on beautifully, smooth without being sticky, and the shimmer was consistent. For myself, I like it best over a deeper colour lipstick, as I found that this colour was more nude on me, and I prefer to go darker with my lippies. It makes a beautiful topper, which is how I'll use it in future. I plan to try other Pat McGrath lip glosses after trying this one. Lovely.

reviews.review_shade_purchased: Bronze Divinity - bronzed rose with gold and pink pearl
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I did receive this product for free as a Sephora Community Insider Ambassador, however all opinions are my own.  I've owned several of these glosses, paid for by my self over the last several years as well, though they are all cream shades.  This was not a shade I would have chosen for myself, and I'm kind of glad that I was sent it.  The base colour is lightly peachy, but a 'my lips but better' shade.  The sparkle in this is pink and gold as advertised.  I can not feel any of the glitter in this formula when I rub my lips together.  The gloss itself feels a bit plush when it's applied and doesn't accentuate any dryness.  The gloss fades over time in a nice way, and is easy to re-apply without a mirror.  It doesn't dry out my lips after applying several times throughout the day.  There is a slight scent to it that dissipates after a minute or two.  It's a sweet smell.   I'll be purchasing more, likely most in the cream formula, however I'll pick up a few glitter and shimmer versions as I see shades that appeal to me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin

This is lovely on bare lips, over lip liner or as a final step in a whole lip routine of liner, lipstick and gloss. Its listed as a glitter, but I felt it has more of a light shimmer but not a full on sparkle like some other shades. In this photo, I‚Äôm wearing as a topper over a lip tint. While I was fortunate to receive this as part of Beauty Insider Community, this is my honest review, and I have purchased other Lust glosses, and will absolutely purchase them again!

reviews.review_title: Beautiful on its own or as a topper
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I love lip products, especially lip glosses. I have a couple of these Pat McGrath Labs lip glosses in my makeup collection and was thrilled to receive Bronze Divinity as part of a holiday gratis last year. This is my honest and authentic opinion, as a Sephora Beauty Insider Community Ambassador after having worn this gloss for the better part of the last month.  WHAT I LIKE:  * Goes on easily and smoothly, which was surprisingly nice for a thicker gloss - it doesn‚Äôt feel heavy, goopy or tacky * Wears comfortably * Smoothing & hydrating  * Adds a beautiful, glossy shine to lips  * Has a slight blurring effect on the lips * Color is beautiful on its own or as a topper - it‚Äôs a shimmery bronzey nude with pretty, rosy gold undertones  * Fairly long wearing for a gloss - I can get about 3-4 hours with it, even with sipping on water, coffee & tea throughout the day, though of course there‚Äôs some fading and wearing away   AREA(S) FOR IMPROVEMENT:  * While Pat McGrath offers a good selection of shades in this line, I wouldn‚Äôt mind seeing the range expand even more.   FYI:  * The thickness of the product makes my lips feel nourished while I have on the gloss   BUY üõçÔ∏è or BYEüëãüèº?:  * A definite BUY

The formula is not sticky or drying on the lips. The color Bronze Divinity is such a beautiful sheer neutral color with sparkle. I love to wear it over lipstick, over other lipglosses for a custom color, or alone. It‚Äôs a beautiful color you can wear with so many makeup looks.  I get compliments whenever I wear PMG lipglosses because they make my lips appear fuller and they have a lovely shine factor. PMG lipglosses usually stay on for more than 4 hours without me having to retouch it. If you have never tried her lipglosses definitely try a mini size to see if you will love it or not.

It also seems more moisturizing than your average lip gloss. It works well on its own, but it‚Äôs also a fantastic topper for lipstick. When applying it, I think it works best to apply a thin layer rather than overapplying the product. I received this product for testing purposes, though I have purchased other shades in the past.

The shade I tried is Bronze Divinity. It has a light shimmery sparkle to it and lasts for a few hours unless I'm eating or drinking.  This is the type of gloss I'd carry in my purse to keep my lips hydrated on the go or to put over a lipstick that felt too drying. I love wearing this and I'd recommend it to any gloss lover. It has a light set scent, almost like vanilla cookies and has a slightly but not overly sticky feel.

The formula is not sticky or drying on the lips. The color Bronze Divinity is such a beautiful sheer neutral color with sparkle. I love to wear it over lipstick, over other lipglosses for a custom color, or alone. It‚Äôs a beautiful color you can wear with so many makeup looks.  I get compliments whenever I wear PMG lipglosses because they make my lips appear fuller and they have a lovely shine factor. PMG lipglosses usually stay on for more than 4 hours without me having to retouch it. If you have never tried her lipglosses definitely try a mini size to see if you will love it or not.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Normal skin

It also seems more moisturizing than your average lip gloss. It works well on its own, but it‚Äôs also a fantastic topper for lipstick. When applying it, I think it works best to apply a thin layer rather than overapplying the product. I received this product for testing purposes, though I have purchased other shades in the past.

While not opaque, this is very pigmented. With lip glosses, I prefer a sheer color that I don't have to worry about escaping my lip line.   Dare to Bare: Pretty standard, very wearable, no-fuss warm nude.   Divine Rose: My favorite shade of any lip product ever, a wonderful cool toned dark-ish neutral that is the color I wished my lips were. I have bought this twice and used them up. I love it. You need it. Now. Buy it!  Sunset Rose: More neutral and peach than divine rose, a little lighter too. Wearable!  Pale Fire Nectar: Clear looking base with obvious pink sparkles. Super pretty, not gritty. I prefer to wear this over another lip product to give it that extra beauty.   Peach Perversion: Perfect summer shade! I love this one, it's a slightly pinker peachy nude and very sheer with a hint of shimmer (not glittery)

Those have become my go to nude glosses.  (I'm a hazelnut chocolate shade, and they look SO good on me.)   I've received countless compliments this gloss.  Even my husband who is used to me in gloss, actually hit me with a Wow your lips look really good today. He notices it every time I wear any of the 3 shades I own.    But seriously if you're on the fence because of the price- try her lip gloss trios.  That's what I did and fell so in love I ended up buying the 3 shades I mentioned above. I will be purchasing a few more shades. These are a staple in my collection now.

reviews.review_text: I own every single PMG lip gloss and bought the entire new range the morning it came out from the brand's website. I have every palette and liner as well. Her products are outstanding, both in quality, appearance, longevity, and experience of luxury. I am just so blown away by the brand. The astral glosses are my absolute favorite. They are stunning to look at and are unique and undupable. The blue and purple (available on her website) astrals are a lot more subtle on the lips. They add a slight sheen of blue (or purple) and are gorgeous when layered on top of her matteTrance lipsticks. Or any lipsticks for that matter. It'll turn your $5 drugstore lipstick into a spectacular and original shade. If you buy any of these glosses you must buy one of the astrals - it's so worth it. They last an incredibly long time and are a good value. And it doesn't look like glitter - just a very lovely shine. I am 44 years old and it doesn't look ridiculous - she sparkly and beautiful. Just be careful with the applicator - when the cylinder is brand new/full, sometimes the doefoot brings up a little extra gloss and it can splatter. This is particularly important with the Flesh4/6, darker, glosses.

I was completely GAGGED to find that it was a fully transparent high shine (like the level of shine that you get from literally a single SWIPE is insane the transformation exceeds explanation you just have to see it in person, I would recommend swatching in stores). When on the lips and out of the tube I didn't really get duochrome per se, but I DID get a gorgine pink-ish shimmer that complements my skin tone beautifully. The colour is somewhat similar to that of the Fenty Beauty Killawatt Foil highlighter in the shade sangria sunset, or they at least pair well. Do not concern yourself with the price tag; the shine lasts and so does this product. I find that using a simple lip balm like carmex or even just petroleum underneath really helps that shine stay glimmering for longer periods of time. I reapply like a madman (but thats because its a nervous habit at this point), and the tubes last me about 1.5ish months. Apply like a normal person and I have no doubt that this will last at least double that.

reviews.review_text: This is my favorite Lust lip gloss from Pat McGrath. I also own (in order from favorite to least favorite) Aliengelic, Blitz Gold, and Paraphernalia. Those were the only colors of interest. It is loaded with shimmer! It has a sheer base and lots of shimmer that looks amazing in indoor and natural light. I like how you can build up the intensity. 2-3 coats is what I go for. It has a sweet smell, long wand, and sturdy tube. The lip gloss lasts a good amount of time. If your eating or drinking, you will need to touch it up more than a lipstick because it has a glossy (wet) formula. So of course it will wear off quickly when touched. When you do touch it up it doesn‚Äôt feel or look clumpy. It‚Äôs very comfortable and I love how it does not have a gritty feel. I don‚Äôt usually have that issue with the high end glosses I use in general. I want to touch on those concerned about sheerness. The ones with clear bases like Gold Allure, Blitz Gold, and Aliengelic aren‚Äôt ‚Äúsheer‚Äù because they don‚Äôt have an opaque color base. For instance Paraphernalia is a pastel purple color and it is the only one I would consider sheer (you need 2x the coats- so like 4-5 coats) to build up the base color- purple. It does show up as light purple eventually but it‚Äôs a lot more work. I‚Äôm more of a gold lip gloss person. I will continue to buy Gold Allure, Blitz Gold, and Aliengelic. It‚Äôs definitely a quality lip gloss and has a thicker formula.

reviews.review_text: I am absolutely impressed with the formula and color of this gloss. It feels hydrating but not sticky at all and doesn't get gunky even after hours of wear. All in all this is a tremendous gloss and will be my go-to from now on. Can't wait to try the other colors!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I got Paraphernalia, Flesh 4, and Gold Blitz. Flesh 4 doesn‚Äôt have any glitter, the other two do, and I love all of them? Slight vanilla scent when you put it on, and it‚Äôs delicious, but it‚Äôs not overwhelming during wear. Pigment is just right for me: not too pigmented, and not too faint. Except for I swatched Blood in the store and that one seems to have the craziest pigment of them all. But the more sheer pigment on the rest make all shades wearable without being crazy. Gorgeous mirror like shine. My absolute favorite thing about this lipgloss is that it wears off completely evenly, no weird color/white rings on the inside of the mouth either, no residue... what magic is this??! So this makes it easy to reapply! It does not bleed outside the lips at all! It feels like nothing on the lips no matter how many layers I put on, And my lips are so soft since I‚Äôve been using it. In terms of how long it lasts: the pigment lasts for an hour on me, and the glossy look lasts forever, at least 3-4 hours which for a gloss is nuts. I like to reapply often for that gorgeous mirror shine and pigment, and I do not mind at all. What‚Äôs important is that it does not build residue after reapplying a few times, and that it does not feel heavy or sticky at all. Love this gloss and it has its own little special place in my collection compared to other high end brand glosses.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was so excited to get this until I actually got. The color is no way near as opaque as it appears to be. I put it on and left the house about an hour later and there was almost no trace of it left on my lips.  If you‚Äôre looking for something that you have to apply constantly all day long then this would be what you want if you want something that‚Äôs going to last this is definitely not it.  I was very disappointed.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This gloss is so fantastic. Pat truly nailed it on this formula. The glosses are long wearing and don‚Äôt get tacky or dry up into tiny crusty flakes. Even when you‚Äôre eating it doesn‚Äôt do any of that. I also find them quite hydrating we‚Äôre others like Clinique pop drys my lips out. Love Pat and I can‚Äôt wait for more!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I got two shades: aliengelic and aphrodisiac. I love them both! Honestly after buying her mothership eyeshadow palettes, Matte Trance Lipstick, and these glosses, I'm convinced you can't go wrong buying something from Pat. These glosses, especially the shine ones like aphrodisiac, smooth out your lips like no other... and thats saying something because I have very textured lips. I loved the color of both, aphrodisiac is the perfect everyday pink for my fair olive skin and aliengelic had a lot more personality to it than I expected-- the pink glitter really pops and makes it much more unique than your run of the mill gloss. The formula is unlike any other gloss I've tried: feels moisturizing, isn't sticky (unless you try to wipe it off or it wears almost completely off and you dont reapply), and it doesn't start to feel clumpy or goopy after being on your lips for awhile. I also love the large, curved doe-foot applicator-- the gloss smoothes easily across your lips. Its also worthwhile to say that I am a lipgloss hater/skeptic, I hate the stickiness and the fact that my hair is constantly getting stuck on my lips, but these glosses have changed my ways. I honestly can't see whats not to love, except for the fact that once you have one you'll want them all and your bank account will likely suffer.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I bought pretty much every single color.  I just didn‚Äôt get the 2 gold glittery ones and Aliengelic one.   They are very pretty and very high shine. True they are not as pigmented as seen on the tubes and swatches but they are a lip gloss. I personally love them.  I think if you want more pigmentation you could apply a liner. But for the spring n summer they are beautiful!!!  I do feel they are pricey but I guess we are paying  the brand just like any other high end brand like Chanel, Dior or any one else.   You will definitely love the formula it‚Äôs amazing. It‚Äôs soft and very nourishing. I love them!!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I want to preface this by saying I love Pat and her makeup artist skills. The gloss itself is fantastic. But if you're charging $28, the gold embossing shouldn't be stickers. I was extremely annoyed that I paid a lot for this gloss to find out the gold on the cap were stickers. I hope she changes that in the future. That's a bold price for stickers.

reviews.review_shade_purchased: Pale Fire Nectar - coral duochrome with pink pearl
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: pale fire nectar is the most beautiful gloss EVER.  I'm fair/light with peachy-pink undertones.  I have never worn a more flattering gloss in my 47 years in this planet.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Great formula, but this is pure glitter, refined, but if you are not into glitter then this is not for you. It looks pretty by itself and also over lipstick.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Gorgeous! This is very glittery in the tube and on the lips, but when you put it over a lipstick the glitter tones down. I love this color and the formula is perfect.

reviews.review_shade_purchased: Flesh Astral - nude rose with gold pearl
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Tan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I love this gloss! The flesh Astral is similar to fenty gloss bomb. The formula isn't tacky or too heavy. I also love the fact this gloss isn't opaque, and I can use it as a lip topper.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Perfect formula, perfect shade!  I've been struggling to find a nude shade that wasn't too dark for my lips but also didn't make my lips appear way lighter than they actually are and this is it! I think it all comes down to the formula, this was glossy without being sticky and opaque so the natural color of my lips was still visible,. it still thick enough that it stayed on.   I will definitely be buying more shades!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Got this in the mail today and was super excited to try this shade out. The gloss feels very nice on the lips not sticky and would look really good by itself or over another lip product that would compliment it flawlessly.      This is my first gloss by pat mcgrath and its definitely won me over into purchasing more. Mother has done it again!

reviews.review_title: Don't know what the fuss is all about
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Got this as I love a bit of coral in my lip colors for summer,its a nice mix of pink and coral, its a thick type lip gloss, not sticky, but heavy. Stayed on the same as any other gloss , you eat and drink, you have to refresh your gloss. Nothing special to me. Not drying.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was sweating out the searches online, but instore saw that mostly nude looking ones all looked...nude.  I thought Flesh Astral was like Fenty Gloss, but more pigment load.  They have a subtle vanilla scent, no flavour and no stickiness.  I was worried it would migrate and run like the LE lip gloss from 2016.  These don‚Äôt. They look, feel and wear with impunity.  Feel good about this splurge.  I do.

reviews.review_title: For a Lipgloss its not that sticky which is good
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've never really looked good in Matte but lipgloss has been my tried and true. I've tried many and for a while liked the Bite Lipglosses colors before they changed their color offerings. But the problem with their formula and many is that it was too sticky. Like gummy sticky.  I think of all the glosses you can't really fine something that won't ever be non sticky necessarily but this wears much more comfortably on the lips than other glosses that I've tried. The color goes well with my foundation color (Rainforest of the Sea: Light Medium Sand). Ugh, now I am tempted to get more from this brand.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Pretty gloss. Lots of product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: The gloss is beautiful, not sticky at all, and actually stays on. It also smells fantastic.  It‚Äôs gloss not lipstick so obviously it‚Äôs going to be more sheer than a lipstick would be, don‚Äôt listen to the 2 and 3 star reviews. If you love a gorgeous gloss then do yourself a favor and buy this product.  10/10 would recommend.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I got 6 shades in 2 days! Fell in love with the amazing formula, unique hues, and juicy glossy finish! I got flesh astral, aliengelic, pale fire nectar, divine rose, bronze temptation, and dare to bare! There is a color for everyone!  Want a simple pinky nude? Dare to bare or flesh astral! Want something fun and bright pale nectar fire or twilo! Want something for every day? Bronze temptation or divine rose! These colors are glide on smoother than butter, are long lasting without being sticky and keep my lips so moisturizer! They don‚Äôt disturb your lipstick underneath either. I love to wear it on its own to show off the sparkle in some of the colors! Worth the price and a pocket friendly if you‚Äôre looking to try a pat McGrath product. You get a good amount too so that helps! Go for it!!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: If you want a great texture, but no color, then Dare to Bare is for you. This looks nice over a lipstick, and it does not change the appearance at all of the lipstick or liner. this has a very light vanilla smell that disappears after 1 minute. I am planning on returning for a color with more pigment, but it is a lovely gloss.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Aliengelic is the color I purchased from her site. It looks stunning in all the promos but is lack luster in real life. It‚Äôs a sheer gloss with a pink glitter that only truly shows in theatric lighting. The gloss itself is a medium-thick body, non sticky formula that I like. The large doe foot applicator is probably the best part of the packaging. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend for summer daytime use but more for going out at night. Isn‚Äôt as high impact as anticipated but I may try another color in the future. If you don‚Äôt have any glosses, try it! If you are a collector of gloss, you‚Äôll probably still buy it but it will sit on the shelf.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Amazing!  Just enough gloss and pigment.  They are so beautiful.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I got in flesh 4. It‚Äôs more like a rosy brownish shade that good for everyday use. And you lips look juicy and plumper but don‚Äôt feel sticky or oily

reviews.review_shade_purchased: Aliengelic - prismatic duochrome infused with pink pearl
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I have Aliengelic, and Flesh Fantasy. I love these glosses. They are so comfortable. And they are pretty! I was worried the micro glitter might make them feel gritty, but no. I have an order for a few others on the way. Great gloss!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I fell in love with color Paraphernalia after seeing it on Instagram. I ordered this gloss the day it became available at Sephora and after receiving it I feel disappointed. It looks very beautiful in the tube and it swatches nicely on a hand, but once applied on the lips it just look meh. I mean it is beautiful, but nothing like online or hand swatches. It has a nice wet/glass finish. It is not very pigmented and the shade looks too sheer on the lips by itself. Unless you layer and layer and layer. I had to redip 3 times to get a nicer more opaque color, but at that point it becomes too wet looking, almost as if you swiped oil on your lips. It is ok when used on top of a lipstick, but still doesn‚Äôt look as I was hoping to, so I‚Äôm not keeping it.  Though it is a light, nice lip gloss that would work fine if I wasn‚Äôt looking for a specific color/look.

reviews.review_shade_purchased: Divine Rose - ultimate plum rose with reflective pearl
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Love the color!! The formula is so smooth! And these last forever

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, auburn hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Don't buy this lip gloss if you don't like sheer color. These glosses are very sheer not pigmented.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I‚Äôm so disappointed in the gloss. I thought I would love it. The color is very milky looking, took some playing with it so it didn‚Äôt look streaky. The gold pearl doesn‚Äôt show up at all. As another reviewer said, the search doesn‚Äôt look the same as in person. I think i will be returning.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: The moment I saw this advertised on Pat McGrath‚Äôs Instagram I knew I had to get this specific colour. I‚Äôve been looking for a blue red lipstick, but what I usually found was some matte and drying lipstick that would drive me insane every time I tried to make a sound.   Lipgloss, however, is always iffy (especially with such a colour). I am BEYOND impressed with this lipgloss. It has amazing colour payoff and the colour is extremely brightly pigmented. I love this lipgloss, I would get the whole range if I could.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, fairLight skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Perfect gloss for gloss haters!  I tend to be a lipstick girl, but as a Pat McGRATH lover I had to try this. The gloss has microglimmer doesn‚Äôt irritate my lips, the gloss is moisturizing and is not sticky. At. ALL. The gloss is opaque and smells delicious. Highly recommended.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I ordered Divine Rose and Aliengelic direct from the Mother. I‚Äôm obsessed with these glosses! First of all, they don‚Äôt feel like glosses though they shine gloriously. These are quite moisturizing and my lips feel better after wearing them. I cannot stand a sticky gloss - there‚Äôs not even the tiniest bit of stickiness with these. Divine Rose is the perfect my-lips-but-better shade for me with just a hint of shimmer. Aliengelic is such a WOW for a clear gloss. It looks like a gloss version of my Rituel de Fille Ara eye soot.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I have all of them and I love them all. Some of the colors are to light for me but it‚Äôs still a good lip topper. It‚Äôs not sticky and very shiney which I love

reviews.review_title: I Hate Glosses But I Love These
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: There was a glitch a few weeks ago on the Canadian site and I was able to pick these up early.  Pat never gives you basic products and this gloss is no exception. The shine is off the charts vinyl but it‚Äôs not sticky at all. In fact, it doesn‚Äôt feel like you‚Äôre wearing anything. Pigmentation varies from shade to shade but overall quality of these glosses is amazing. They have a light vanilla scent but no taste.

reviews.review_title: I cannot sing your praises more!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I purchased Bronze Temptation along with Gold Allure, Fantasy Flesh and Flesh4.  Without a doubt, I absolutely loved every single color.  No buyers remorse here!  The colors are really wearable for daytime and nightime looks.  For me, every single color worked and complimented my med-tan skin tone with yellow undertones.  I am a fan of so many features of this product... color, brush applicator, quality (not sticky and feels light on the lips) and the amount of product in the tube.  It also looks great layered over other creme/matte lipsticks.  The only negative for me is the price but it is Pat McGrath and to be expected from this line.  I can see why every tube is sold out!

reviews.review_title: Buyer Beware: Minimal Pigmentation. Very Sheer.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I purchased all shades and vastly disappointed. Not a single shade comes out true to what the lip-photos or swatches show.  The formula is devine but the pigmentation is a far cry from what is advertised. If used over a Pat lipliner or lipgloss, then the color shows truer to what is on the lip model photos and arm swatches.  I absolutely LOVE the lipsticks, lip liners, eye liners and eye shadow pallets, but am overwhelmingly disappointed in the gloss.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, auburn hair, Deep skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Rich in color. Not like a tint. Wear alone, or over color ...for deeper coverage. Love it!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Love this lipgloss, ordered it from PAT McGRATH website along with the bundle and I am loving them. Love how the gold allure reflects in the light !

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really love this for summer! It‚Äôs not sticky, which is surprising! It sort of just feels like lip balm. The packaging is nice and sleek. It also smells really nice. Kind of sweet. I would def recommend. I will def be getting more colors.
